analyzed: tam ātma stham ye nupaśyanti dhīrāḥ teṣām śāntiḥ śāśvatī na itareṣām  sa vyāsa pitaram dṛṣṭvā sva dīptyā parayā yutam
translated: those wise ones who see him dwelling in the self, for them there is eternal peace, not for others.🔽O Vyasa, seeing his father endowed with his own supreme radiance,

analyzed: putra kāmaḥ prajā hetoḥ tapaḥ tīvram cakāra ha
translated: desiring a son and for the sake of offspring, he performed severe austerities.🔽In a short time, the father was pleased with the greatly illustrious one,

original: mahatā yogatapasā yuktasya sumahātmanaḥ /🔽acireṇaiva kālena pitā sampratutoṣa ha // / //
analyzed: mahatā yoga tapasā yuktasya su mahātmanaḥ 🔽acireṇa eva kālena pitā sampratutoṣa ha
translated: who was engaged in great yoga and austerity.

analyzed: darśanam ca āgamat tasya vara daḥ smi iti uvāca ha
translated: And the vision of that (Lord) appeared to him, and he said, I am the bestower of boons.

original: sa tuṣṭāva nato bhūtvā kṛtvā śirasi cāñjalim // / //
analyzed: sa tuṣṭāva nataḥ bhūtvā kṛtvā śirasi ca añjalim
translated: He, having bowed down, with folded hands on his head, praised (him).

analyzed: namaḥ parama devāya devānām api vedhase
translated: Salutations to the Supreme God, the creator even of the gods.

original: sraṣṭre vai lokatantrāya brahmaṇaḥ pataye namaḥ // / //
analyzed: sraṣṭre vai lokatantrāya brahmaṇaḥ pataye namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the creator, to the sustainer of the worlds, to the Lord of Brahman.

original: ekasmai śaktiyuktāya aśaktirahitāya ca /🔽anantāyāprameyāya indriyāviṣayāya ca // / //
analyzed: ekasmai śakti yuktāya aśakti rahitāya ca  anantāya aprameyāya indriya aviṣayāya ca
translated: To the One endowed with power, and to the One devoid of power,🔽To the Infinite, to the Immeasurable, to the One beyond the senses.

analyzed: vyāpine vyāpta pūrvāya adhiṣṭhātre pracodine  kṛta pracetanāya eva tattva vinyāsa kāriṇe
translated: To the Pervader, to the One who has pervaded before, to the Presiding Lord, to the Impeller,🔽To the One who has given consciousness, to the One who has arranged the principles.

analyzed: pradhāna codakāya eva guṇinām śānti dāya ca
translated: To the Impeller of Prakriti itself, to the Bestower of Peace to the Possessors of Qualities,

original: dṛṣṭidāya ca sarveṣāṃ svayaṃ vai darśanāya ca // / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭi dāya ca sarveṣām svayam vai darśanāya ca
translated: To the Bestower of Vision to all, to the One who is Himself the Vision,

analyzed: viṣaya grāhiṇe ca eva niyamasya ca kāriṇe
translated: To the One who apprehends objects, and to the One who acts according to rules,

original: manasaḥ karaṇānāṃ ca tatraiva niyamasya ca // / //
analyzed: manasaḥ karaṇānām ca tatra eva niyamasya ca
translated: To the One who is the regulator of the mind and the senses, and of the rules therein,

original: bhūtānāṃ guṇakartre ca śaktidāya tathaiva ca /
analyzed: bhūtānām guṇa kartre ca śakti dāya tathā eva ca
translated: To the One who is the agent of the qualities of the elements, and to the One who bestows power,

original: kartre hyaṇḍasya mahyaṃ ca acintyāyāgrajāya ca /
analyzed: kartre hi aṇḍasya mahyam ca acintyāya agrajāya ca
translated: To the Creator of the Egg, to the One who is inconceivable, to the Eldest,

original: aprameya pitarnityaṃ prīto no diśa śakvarīm // / //
analyzed: aprameya pitar nityam prītaḥ naḥ diśa śakvarīm
translated: To the One of immeasurable power, O Father, always pleased, grant us the boon.

original: tasyaivaṃ stuvato vyāsa devadevo maheśvaraḥ /🔽tuṣṭo 'bravītsvayaṃ putraṃ brahmāṇaṃ praṇataṃ tathā // / //
analyzed: tasya evam stuvataḥ vyāsa devadevaḥ maheśvaraḥ  tuṣṭaḥ bravīt svayam putram brahmāṇam praṇatam tathā
translated: O Vyasa, while he was thus praising, Maheshvara, the god of gods,🔽being pleased, spoke to his son Brahma, who was bowing down,

analyzed: yasmāt te viditam vatsa sūkṣmam etat mahā dyute
translated: O son, since you have known this subtle (truth), O you of great luster,

analyzed: tasmāt brahmā iti lokeṣu nāmnā khyātim gamiṣyasi
translated: therefore, you will become famous in the worlds by the name Brahma.

analyzed: yasmāt ca aham pitā iti uktaḥ tvayā buddhimatām vara
translated: Since you, the best among the intelligent, have addressed me as 'father,'

analyzed: tasmāt pitāmaha tvam te loke khyātim gamiṣyati
translated: therefore, your status as the grandfather will become famous in the world.

original: prajārthaṃ yacca te taptaṃ tapa ugraṃ suduścaram /
analyzed: prajā artham yat ca te taptam tapaḥ ugram su duścaram
translated: And since you have performed severe austerities, very difficult to perform, for the sake of offspring,

analyzed: tasmāt prajāpati tvam te dadāni prayata ātmane
translated: therefore, I grant you the status of Prajapati, to you who have purified your soul.

analyzed: evam uktvā sa deveśaḥ sṛjat striyaḥ
translated: Having said this, the Lord of gods created women in embodied form,

analyzed: yāḥ tāḥ prakṛtayaḥ tu aṣṭau viśeṣāḥ ca indriyaiḥ saha
translated: those eight primordial natures, and the specific (natures) along with the senses,

original: bhāvāśca sarve te devam upatasthuḥ svarūpiṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: bhāvāḥ ca sarve te devam upatasthuḥ sva rūpiṇaḥ
translated: and all the emotions, in their embodied forms, approached the god.

analyzed: tān uvāca tatas devaḥ patiḥ yuktaḥ sva tejasā
translated: Then the god, the lord, endowed with his own radiance, said to them,

analyzed: etam adya abhiṣekeṇa sampādayata mā ciram
translated: Quickly perform his consecration today.

original: tābhiḥ svaṃ svaṃ samādāya bhāvaṃ divyamatarkitam /
analyzed: tābhiḥ svam svam samādāya bhāvam divyam atarkitam
translated: They, having taken up their own divine and inconceivable nature,

analyzed: abhiṣiktaḥ babhūva iti prajāpatiḥ atidyutiḥ
translated: was consecrated, the very radiant Prajapati.

original: tatraivaṃ yoginaḥ sūkṣmaṃ dṛṣṭvā divyena cakṣuṣā /
analyzed: tatra evam yoginaḥ sūkṣmam dṛṣṭvā divyena cakṣuṣā
translated: There, the yogis, having seen the subtle form of the Lord with their divine eye,

analyzed: purāṇam yoga tattva jñāḥ gāyanti triguṇa anvitam
translated: the knowers of the truth of yoga sing about the Purana endowed with the three qualities.

original: rudraḥ sraṣṭā hi sarveṣāṃ bhūtānāṃ tava ca prabho /
analyzed: rudraḥ sraṣṭā hi sarveṣām bhūtānām tava ca prabho
translated: Rudra is indeed the creator of all beings and of you, O Lord.

analyzed: asmābhiḥ ca bhavān sārdham jagataḥ sampravartakaḥ
translated: And you, along with us, are the promoter of the world.

analyzed: sa devaḥ toṣitaḥ samyak parama aiśvarya yoga dhṛk
translated: That God, who is satisfied, who holds the yoga of supreme lordship,

analyzed: brahmāṇam agrajam putram prājāpatye bhyaṣecayat
translated: consecrated his eldest son Brahma as the lord of Prajapati.

analyzed: yaḥ kṛtvā bahuvidha mārga yoga yuktam tattva ākhyam jagat idam ādarāt yuyoja
translated: He, who having adopted the yoga of many paths, properly engaged this world known as the truth,

analyzed: devānām paramam ananta yoga yuktam māyābhiḥ tribhuvanam andham aprasādam
translated: the supreme, endless yoga of the gods, the three worlds blinded by illusion, without grace,

original: sarveṣāṃ manasi sadāvatiṣṭhamāno jānānaḥ śubhamaśubhaṃ ca bhūtanāthaḥ /
analyzed: sarveṣām manasi sadā avatiṣṭhamānaḥ jānānaḥ śubham aśubham ca bhūtanāthaḥ
translated: the lord of beings, who always resides in the mind of all, who knows good and bad,

original: taṃ devaṃ pramathapatiṃ praṇamya bhaktyā nityaṃ vai śaraṇamupaimi sūkṣmasūkṣmam // / //
analyzed: tam devam pramatha patim praṇamya bhaktyā nityam vai śaraṇam upaimi sūkṣma sūkṣmam
translated: I always bow with devotion to that God, the lord of the Pramathas, and seek refuge in the very subtle one.

analyzed: iti skandapurāṇe tṛtīyaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the third chapter in the Skanda Purana.

analyzed: skanda pura na
translated: Skanda Purana

analyzed: sanatkumāraḥ uvāca
translated: Sanatkumara said:

original: prājāpatyaṃ tato labdhvā prajāḥ sraṣṭuṃ pracakrame /
analyzed: prājāpatyam tatas labdhvā prajāḥ sraṣṭum pracakrame
translated: Having obtained the Prajapati status, he began to create beings.

original: prajāstāḥ sṛjyamānāśca na vivardhanti tasya ha // / //🔽sa kurvāṇastathā sṛṣṭiṃ śaktihīnaḥ pitāmahaḥ /
analyzed: prajāḥ tāḥ sṛjyamānāḥ ca na vivardhanti tasya ha  sa kurvāṇaḥ tathā sṛṣṭim śakti hīnaḥ pitāmahaḥ
translated: But those beings that were being created did not multiply.🔽The grandfather, who was weak in power, continued to create.

analyzed: sṛṣṭi artham bhūyas eva atha tapaḥ cartum pracakrame
translated: Then, for the sake of creation, he again began to perform austerities.

translated: Knowing that he was performing austerities for the sake of creation, the lord of the three worlds🔽pervading the world with his radiance, came to him.

analyzed: sraṣṭā tasya jagannāthaḥ darśayat sva tanau jagat
translated: The creator, the lord of the world, showed him the universe in his own body.

analyzed: svayam āgatya deveśaḥ mahā bhūtapatiḥ haraḥ
translated: Having come himself, Hara, the lord of gods and the lord of great beings,

analyzed: vyāpya iva hi jagat kṛtsnam parameṇa sva tejasā
translated: pervading the entire world with his supreme radiance,

original: śambhuḥ prāha varaṃ vatsa yācasveti pitāmaham // / //
analyzed: śambhuḥ prāha varam vatsa yācasva iti pitāmaham
translated: Shambhu said to the grandfather, O child, ask for a boon.

analyzed: tam brahmā loka sṛṣṭi artham putraḥ tvam manasā bravīt
translated: Brahma, for the sake of creating the world, mentally said to him, Be my son.

original: sa jñātvā tasya saṃkalpaṃ brahmaṇaḥ parameśvaraḥ /
analyzed: sa jñātvā tasya saṃkalpam brahmaṇaḥ parameśvaraḥ
translated: The supreme lord, knowing Brahma's intention,

analyzed: mūḍhaḥ yam iti saṃcintya provāca vara daḥ svayam
translated: thinking that he was deluded, himself, the giver of boons, said:

analyzed: āgatam pitaram mā tvam yasmāt putram samīhase

analyzed: mad mūrtiḥ tanayaḥ tasmāt bhaviṣyati mama ājñayā

analyzed: sa ca te putra tām yātvā madīyaḥ gaṇanāyakaḥ
translated: And he, my chief of the Ganas, will become your son.

analyzed: rudraḥ vigrahavān bhūtvā mūḍha tvām vinayiṣyati
translated: Rudra, having become embodied, will subdue you, O fool.

analyzed: sarva vidyā ādhipatyam ca yogānām ca eva sarvaśas
translated: And the lordship of all the Vidyadharas, and of all the Yogas,

analyzed: balasya adhipati tvam ca astrāṇām ca prayoktṛ tā
translated: And the sovereignty of strength, and the employment of weapons,

original: mayā dattāni tasyāśu upasthāsyanti sarvaśaḥ /🔽dhanuḥ pinākaṃ śūlaṃ ca khaḍgaṃ paraśureva ca // / //🔽kamaṇḍalustathā daṇḍaḥ astraṃ pāśupataṃ tathā /
analyzed: mayā dattāni tasya āśu upasthāsyanti sarvaśas  dhanuḥ pinākam śūlam ca khaḍgam paraśuḥ eva ca  kamaṇḍaluḥ tathā daṇḍaḥ astram pāśupatam tathā
translated: Will all quickly be given to him by me.🔽The bow Pinaka, the trident, the sword, the axe,🔽The water-pot, the staff, the Pasupata weapon,

analyzed: saṃvartaka aśaniḥ ca eva cakram ca pratisargikam
translated: The Samvartaka thunderbolt, and the Cakra of dissolution,

analyzed: evam sarva ṛddhi sampannaḥ sutaḥ te sa bhaviṣyati
translated: Thus your son will be endowed with all prosperity.

analyzed: evam uktvā gate tasmin antardhānam mahātmani
translated: Having said this, when that great soul disappeared,

analyzed: brahmā cakre tadā ca iṣṭim putra kāmaḥ prajāpatiḥ  sa juhvan śrama saṃyuktaḥ pratighāta samanvitaḥ
translated: Brahma, the lord of creatures, desirous of a son, then performed a sacrifice.🔽While offering oblations, he became tired and frustrated.

analyzed: samidh yuktena hastena lalāṭam pramamārja ha
translated: With a hand holding the sacrificial twig, he wiped his forehead.

analyzed: samidh saṃyoga jaḥ tasya sveda binduḥ lalāṭa jaḥ
translated: A drop of sweat born from the union with the Samidha fell on his forehead.

original: papāta jvalane tasmin dviguṇaṃ tasya tejasā // / //
analyzed: papāta jvalane tasmin dviguṇam tasya tejasā
translated: It fell into the fire, doubling its energy.

analyzed: tat hi māheśvaram tejaḥ saṃdhitam brahmaṇi srutam
translated: That is the energy of Mahesha, united with Brahma and flowing.

analyzed: preritam devadevena nipapāta

analyzed: kṣaṇe tasmin maheśena smṛtvā tam varam uttamam
translated: At that moment, Mahesha remembered that excellent boon.

analyzed: preṣitaḥ gaṇapaḥ rudraḥ sadyas evā bhavat tadā

analyzed: tat ca saṃsveda jam tejaḥ pūrvam jvalana yojitam
translated: That energy born from sweat, previously united with fire,

analyzed: bhūtvā lohitam āśu eva punar nīlam abhūt tadā
translated: became red in a moment and then became blue again.

analyzed: nīlalohitaḥ iti eva tena asau abhavat prabhuḥ
translated: Therefore, the Lord became known as Nila-Lohita.

original: tryakṣo daśabhujaḥ śrīmān brahmāṇaṃ chādayanniva // / //🔽śarvādyairnāmabhirbrahmā tanūbhiśca jalādibhiḥ /
analyzed: tryakṣaḥ daśa bhujaḥ śrīmān brahmāṇam chādayan iva  śarva ādyaiḥ nāmabhiḥ brahmā tanūbhiḥ ca jala ādibhiḥ
translated: Having three eyes, ten arms, and prosperous, he seemed to cover Brahma.

analyzed: stutvā tam sarvagam devam nīlalohitam avyayam
translated: Brahma praised that all-pervading, imperishable god Nila-Lohita with names like Sharva and with forms like water.

analyzed: jñātvā sarva sṛjam paścāt mahābhūta pratiṣṭhitam
translated: Having known him as the creator of all, established in the great elements,

analyzed: asṛjat vividhāḥ tu anyāḥ prajāḥ sa jagati prabhuḥ
translated: that Lord of the world created various other beings.

analyzed: saḥ pi yogam samāsthāya aiśvaryeṇa samanvitaḥ
translated: He too, having attained yoga, endowed with lordship,

analyzed: lokān sarvān samāviśya dhārayāmāsa sarvadā
translated: pervading all the worlds, always sustained them.

analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ pi tatas putrāḥ dakṣa dharma ādayaḥ śubhāḥ
translated: Then the sons of Brahma, the auspicious ones like Daksha and Dharma,

analyzed: asṛjanta prajāḥ sarvāḥ deva mānuṣa saṃkulāḥ
translated: created all the beings, full of gods and humans.

original: atha kālena mahatā kalpe 'tīte punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: atha kālena mahatā kalpe tīte punar punar
translated: Then, after a great length of time, when the kalpa had passed again and again,

original: prajā dhārayato yogād asminkalpa upasthite // / //🔽pratiṣṭhitāyāṃ vārttāyāṃ pravṛtte vṛṣṭisarjane /
analyzed: prajāḥ dhārayataḥ yogāt asmin kalpe upasthite  pratiṣṭhitāyām vārttāyām pravṛtte vṛṣṭi sarjane
translated: when this kalpa had arrived, he sustained the beings through yoga.🔽When the livelihood was established, when the rain had begun to fall,

analyzed: prajāsu ca vivṛddhāsu prayāge yajataḥ ca ha
translated: and when the beings had increased, while he was performing a sacrifice at Prayaga,

analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ ṣaṭkulīyāḥ te ṛṣayaḥ saṃśita vratāḥ
translated: those sages of the six families, of rigid vows,

analyzed: marīcayaḥ trayaḥ ca eva vasiṣṭhāḥ kratavaḥ tathā
translated: the Marichis, Atri, Vasishtha, Kratu,

analyzed: bhṛgavaḥ ṅgirasaḥ ca eva tapasā dagdha kilbiṣāḥ
translated: the Bhrigus and Angiras, their sins burnt away by austerities,

analyzed: ūcuḥ brahmāṇam abhyetya sahitāḥ karmaṇaḥ ntare
translated: approached Brahma together and spoke to him during a break in the ritual:

analyzed: bhagavan andhakāreṇa mahatā smaḥ samāvṛtāḥ
translated: O Lord, we are completely enveloped in a great darkness.

original: khinnā vivadamānāśca na ca paśyāma yatparam // / //
analyzed: khinnāḥ vivadamānāḥ ca na ca paśyāma yat param
translated: We are tired and disputing, and we do not see what is supreme.

original: etaṃ naḥ saṃśayaṃ deva ciraṃ hṛdi samāsthitam /
analyzed: etam naḥ saṃśayam deva ciram hṛdi samāsthitam
translated: O God, this doubt has been long cherished in our hearts.

original: tvaṃ hi vettha yathātattvaṃ kāraṇaṃ paramaṃ hi naḥ // / //
analyzed: tvam hi vettha yathātattvam kāraṇam paramam hi naḥ
translated: You alone know the true cause of ours.

analyzed: kim param sarva bhūtānām balīyaḥ ca api sarvatas
translated: What is supreme among all beings and most powerful in every way?

original: kena cādhiṣṭhitaṃ viśvaṃ ko nityaḥ kaśca śāśvataḥ // / //
analyzed: kena ca adhiṣṭhitam viśvam kaḥ nityaḥ kaḥ ca śāśvataḥ
translated: By whom is the universe controlled? Who is eternal and who is permanent?

analyzed: kaḥ sraṣṭā sarva bhūtānām prakṛteḥ ca pravartakaḥ
translated: Who is the creator of all beings and the instigator of primordial nature?

analyzed: kaḥ smān sarveṣu kāryeṣu prayunakti mahā manāḥ
translated: By whom is the great-minded one engaged in all our tasks?

analyzed: kasya bhūtāni vaśyāni kaḥ sarva viniyojakaḥ
translated: To whom are all beings subject? Who is the ordainer of everything?

original: kathaṃ paśyema taṃ caiva etannaḥ śaṃsa sarvaśaḥ // / //🔽evamuktastato brahmā sarveṣāmeva saṃnidhau /
analyzed: katham paśyema tam ca eva etat naḥ śaṃsa sarvaśas  evam uktaḥ tatas brahmā sarveṣām eva saṃnidhau
translated: How should we see him? Please tell us all this.

original: devānāṃ ca ṛṣīṇāṃ ca gandharvoragarakṣasām // / //🔽yakṣāṇāmasurāṇāṃ ca ye ca kutra pravartakāḥ /
analyzed: devānām ca ṛṣīṇām ca gandharva uraga rakṣasām  yakṣāṇām asurāṇām ca ye ca kutra pravartakāḥ
translated: Thus addressed, Brahma, in the presence of all the gods, sages, gandharvas, serpents, demons,🔽yakshas, asuras, and others who were engaged in various activities,

analyzed: pakṣiṇām sa piśācānām ye ca anye tad samīpa gāḥ
translated: birds, pishachas, and others who were nearby,

original: utthāya prāñjaliḥ prāha rudreti triḥ plutaṃ vacaḥ // / //
analyzed: utthāya prāñjaliḥ prāha rudra iti tris plutam vacaḥ
translated: arose and spoke the word Rudra three times with joined palms.

original: sa cāpi tapasā śakyo draṣṭuṃ nānyena kenacit /
analyzed: sa ca api tapasā śakyaḥ draṣṭum na anyena kenacid
translated: And he can only be seen through austerities, not by anyone else.

analyzed: sa sraṣṭā sarva bhūtānām balavān tanmayam jagat
translated: He is the creator of all beings, powerful, and the universe is full of him.

original: tasya vaśyāni bhūtāni tenedaṃ dhāryate jagat // / //
analyzed: tasya vaśyāni bhūtāni tena idam dhāryate jagat
translated: All beings are under his control, and by him this world is sustained.

analyzed: tatas te sarva lokeśāḥ namaḥ cakruḥ mahātmane
translated: Then all the lords of the worlds bowed to the great soul.

analyzed: ṛṣayaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The sages said:

original: kiṃ tanmahattapo deva yena dṛśyeta sa prabhuḥ /
analyzed: kim tat mahat tapaḥ deva yena dṛśyeta sa prabhuḥ
translated: What is that great austerity, O god, by which that lord can be seen?

original: tanno vadasva deveśa varadaṃ cābhidhatsva naḥ // / //
analyzed: tat naḥ vadasva deveśa vara dam ca abhidhatsva naḥ
translated: Tell us that, O lord of gods, and declare to us the giver of boons.

analyzed: pitāmahaḥ uvāca

original: pīyatīnāṃ payo vegāt phenaṃ mūrdhni samāpatat // / //
analyzed: pīyatīnām payaḥ vegāt phenam mūrdhni samāpatat
translated: The foam fell on my head.

analyzed: tatas mayā ūrdhvam dṛṣṭāḥ tu gāvaḥ tāḥ soma pārśva gāḥ
translated: Then, looking upwards, I saw those cows near Soma.

analyzed: tatas tāḥ prekṣitāḥ tatra mayāḥ gāvaḥ tadā abhavan
translated: Then, those cows were seen by me there.

analyzed: tejasā dahyamānāḥ tu na eka varṇāḥ bhṛśa arditāḥ
translated: Burning with brilliance, of various colors, greatly afflicted,

analyzed: gāvaḥ pūrvam imāḥ devi āsan kapila varṇa jāḥ
translated: O Goddess, in the past, these cows were born of the color of Kapila.

analyzed: na eka varṇāḥ tadā abhūvan yadā samprekṣitāḥ mayā
translated: When I looked at them, they became of various colors.

analyzed: tāsām śaraṇya tām yātvā tābhiḥ mām eva śailaje
translated: O Daughter of the Mountain, having gone to them for refuge, they alone protect me.

original: āśritaḥ soma āgatya saha gobhirna tāstyajat // / //
analyzed: āśritaḥ somaḥ āgatya saha gobhiḥ na tāḥ tyajat
translated: O Daughter of the Mountain, having become their refuge, I was resorted to by them alone, and Soma, having come with the cows, did not abandon them.

original: arditābhistadā gobhir brahmā māmabravīttataḥ /🔽prasādaṃ kuru deveśa surabhīstejasā tava /
analyzed: arditābhiḥ tadā gobhiḥ brahmā mām abravīt tatas  prasādam kuru deveśa surabhīḥ tejasā tava
translated: Then, afflicted by the cows, Brahma spoke to me:

original: na naśyanti yathā sadyas tathā sarvasurārcita // / //
analyzed: na naśyanti yathā sadyas tathā sarva sura arcita
translated: Be gracious, O Lord of gods, O you who are worshipped by all the gods, so that the cows do not perish immediately by your brilliance.

analyzed: tatas ham āsthitaḥ devi sthāne smin svayam eva tu
translated: Then, O Goddess, I myself resorted to this place,

analyzed: goprekṣakaḥ iti khyātaḥ saṃstutaḥ sarva devataiḥ
translated: known as Go-prekshaka, praised by all the gods.

analyzed: goprekṣeśvaram āgatya dṛṣṭvā ca arcya ca mānavaḥ
translated: A man who comes to Go-preksheśvara, sees and worships it,

original: na durgatimavāpnoti kalmaṣaiśca vimucyate // / //🔽tatastā dahyamānāstu prasanne surabhīrmayi /
analyzed: na durgatim avāpnoti kalmaṣaiḥ ca vimucyate  tatas tāḥ dahyamānāḥ tu prasanne surabhīḥ mayi
translated: does not attain misfortune and is freed from sins.🔽Then, the cows, burning with heat, were pleased with me, the fragrant one.

analyzed: hrade smin petuḥ abhyetya śāntāḥ tāḥ vibabhuḥ tadā
translated: Having come to this lake, they entered it, and being cooled, they shone forth.

analyzed: kapilāhradaḥ iti evam tadā prabhṛti kathyate
translated: From that time onwards, it is called Kapila-hrada.

analyzed: atrā api svayam eva aham vṛṣadhvajaḥ iti śrutaḥ
translated: Here also, I myself am known as Vrishadhvaja.

original: sāṃnidhyaṃ kṛtavāndevi sa cāyaṃ dṛśyatāṃ sthitaḥ // / //
analyzed: sāṃnidhyam kṛtavān devi sa ca ayam dṛśyatām sthitaḥ
translated: O Goddess, I have made my presence here, and it is seen to be standing.

analyzed: kapilāhrada tīrthe smin snātvā na anya manāḥ naraḥ
translated: A man who bathes in this Kapilāhrada Tīrtha, with a concentrated mind,

analyzed: vṛṣadhvajam imam dṛṣṭvā sarva yajña phalam labhet
translated: and sees this Vṛṣadhvaja (Śiva), would obtain the fruit of all sacrifices.

analyzed: salokatām mṛtaḥ ca api arcayitvā tu mām iha
translated: Having worshipped me here, one attains the same world (as mine) after death.

analyzed: labhate dehabhede tu gaṇa tvam ca ati durlabham
translated: And after the dissolution of the body, one attains the state of a Gaṇa, which is very difficult to attain.

original: asminnapi pradeśe tu tā gāvo brahmaṇā svayam /
analyzed: asmin api pradeśe tu tāḥ gāvaḥ brahmaṇā svayam
translated: In this region also, those cows were milked by Brahmā himself

analyzed: śānti artham sarva lokānām sarvāḥ dugdhāḥ payaḥ mṛtam
translated: for the welfare of all the worlds, and all of them yielded nectar-like milk.

analyzed: tāsām kṣīreṇa saṃjātam hradam etat manoharam
translated: From that milk, this charming lake was formed.

analyzed: bhadradoham iti khyātam puṇyam deva vanam śubham
translated: It is known as Bhadradoha, a sacred, auspicious and divine forest.

analyzed: sarvaiḥ devaiḥ aham devi asmin deśe prasāditaḥ
translated: O Goddess, in this region, all the gods pleased me,

analyzed: gaccha upaśamam īśa iti upaśānta śivaḥ tatas
translated: saying, O Lord, go to peace. Then, being pacified, Śiva

analyzed: sthitaḥ bhūtvā aham atra sthaḥ puṇyam asya api darśanam
translated: remained here, and the sight of this is also meritorious.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā enam prayataḥ martyaḥ svarga lokam avāpnuyāt
translated: A man who sees it with self-control would attain heaven.

analyzed: atra aham brahmaṇā ānīya sthāpitaḥ parameṣṭhinā
translated: Here I was brought by Brahmā and installed by the Supreme Lord.

analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ ca api saṃgṛhya viṣṇunā sthāpitaḥ punar
translated: And having taken me from Brahmā, I was again installed by Viṣṇu.

original: brahmaṇā sa tato viṣṇuḥ proktaḥ saṃvignacetasā /
analyzed: brahmaṇā sa tatas viṣṇuḥ proktaḥ saṃvigna cetasā
translated: Then Brahma, with a troubled mind, spoke to Vishnu:

analyzed: mayā ānītam idam liṅgam kasmāt sthāpitavān asi
translated: Why have you installed this Linga brought by me?

analyzed: tam uvāca punar viṣṇuḥ brahmāṇam kupita ānanam
translated: Vishnu again spoke to Brahma, his face angry:

analyzed: rudra deve mama atyantam purā bhaktiḥ mahattarā
translated: In the past, my devotion to Lord Rudra was very great.

analyzed: mayā eṣa sthāpitaḥ tena nāmnā tava bhaviṣyati
translated: Since it was installed by me, it will be named after you.

analyzed: hiraṇyagarbhaḥ iti evam trayaḥ aham samāsthitaḥ
translated: I have thus remained here as Hiranyagarbha.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā enam api deveśam mama lokam vrajet naraḥ
translated: Seeing this Lord of the gods, a man will go to my world.

original: punaścāpi tato brahmā mama liṅgamimaṃ śubhe /
analyzed: punar ca api tatas brahmā mama liṅgam imam śubhe
translated: Then Brahma again, in this auspicious place,

analyzed: sthāpayāmāsa vidhivat bhaktyā paramayā yutaḥ
translated: installed this auspicious Linga of mine, endowed with supreme devotion, in accordance with the rules.

analyzed: svarlīneśvaraḥ iti evam atra aham svayam āsthitaḥ
translated: I myself have remained here as Svarlina.

analyzed: svasmin paratare līnaḥ pradhāne mama kāraṇe
translated: Merged in the supreme, in the primary cause of mine,

original: tasmātsvarlīna ityevaṃ guhyaṃ kṣetraṃ mama smṛtam // / //
analyzed: tasmāt svarlīnaḥ iti evam guhyam kṣetram mama smṛtam
translated: Therefore, this secret place of mine is known as Svarlina.

analyzed: prāṇān iha naraḥ tyaktvā na punar jāyate kvacid
translated: A man who gives up his life here is not born again anywhere.

original: ānantyā sā gatistasya yogināṃ caiva sā smṛtā // / //
analyzed: ānantyā sā gatiḥ tasya yoginām ca eva sā smṛtā
translated: That is the endless goal, remembered as the goal of the yogis.

original: asminnapi mayā deśe daityo devatakaṇṭakaḥ /🔽vyāghrarūpaṃ samāsthāya nihato darpito balī // / //
analyzed: asmin api mayā deśe daityaḥ devata kaṇṭakaḥ  vyāghra rūpam samāsthāya nihataḥ darpitaḥ balī
translated: In this place also, a demon, a thorn to the gods,🔽was killed by me, a proud and powerful one who had assumed the form of a tiger.

analyzed: vyāghreśvaraḥ tatas khyātaḥ nityam atra aham āsthitaḥ
translated: Therefore, I am known as Vyagresvara, always present here.

analyzed: na punar durgatim yāti dṛṣṭvā enam amara īśvaram
translated: Having seen this lord of the immortals, one does not go to a bad rebirth again.

original: utpalo vidalaścaiva yau daityau brahmaṇā purā /
analyzed: utpalaḥ vidalaḥ ca eva yau daityau brahmaṇā purā
translated: The two demons Utpalaka and Vidala, who were created by Brahma in the past,

original: strīvadhyau darpitau sṛṣṭau tvayaiva nihatau śubhe /🔽sāvajñaṃ gendukenātra tasyedaṃ cihnamāsthitam // / //
analyzed: strī vadhyau darpitau sṛṣṭau tvayā eva nihatau śubhe  sa avajñam gendukena atra tasya idam cihnam āsthitam
translated: were killed by you, O auspicious one, who were proud and destined to be killed by a woman.🔽This mark was placed on him here by Ginduka with contempt.

analyzed: ādau atra aham āgatya āsthitaḥ gaṇapaiḥ saha
translated: Having come here first, I have taken up residence here with the chief ganas.

analyzed: jyeṣṭham sthānam idam tasmāt etat me puṇya darśanam
translated: Therefore, this is my eldest place, and it is auspicious to see.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā imam mama liṅgam tu jyeṣṭhasthāna samāśritam
translated: Having seen this linga of mine, which is situated in the eldest place,

analyzed: na śocati punar martyaḥ saṃsiddhaḥ mṛtyu janmanī
translated: a mortal does not grieve again, being perfected in death and birth.

analyzed: samantāt devataiḥ sarvaiḥ liṅgāni sthāpitāni ha
translated: Everywhere, all the gods have installed lingas.

original: dṛṣṭvā tu niyato martyo dehabhede gaṇo bhavet // / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā tu niyataḥ martyaḥ dehabhede gaṇaḥ bhavet
translated: Having seen them, a restrained mortal, upon the dissolution of the body, becomes a gana.

analyzed: idānīm aham āgatya svayam asmin vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Now, having come here, I myself am established in this place.

original: na ca muktaṃ mayā yasmād avimuktamidaṃ tataḥ /
analyzed: na ca muktam mayā yasmāt avimuktam idam tatas
translated: And since it has not been released by me, this place will become known as Avimukta.

analyzed: kṣetram vārāṇasī puṇyā mukti dam sambhaviṣyati
translated: The sacred place of Varanasi will be the giver of liberation.

original: avimukteśvaraṃ māṃ vai yo 'tra drakṣyati mānavaḥ /
analyzed: avimukteśvaram mām vai yaḥ tra drakṣyati mānavaḥ
translated: The man who sees me here as Avimukteshvara,

original: gāṇapatyā gatistasya yatra tatra mṛtasya ha /
analyzed: gāṇapatyā gatiḥ tasya yatra tatra mṛtasya ha
translated: Wherever he dies, he will attain the state of Ganapati.

analyzed: prāṇān iha tu saṃnyasya yāsyate muktim uttamām
translated: Abandoning his life here, he will attain the highest liberation.

original: pitrā te girirājena purā himavatā svayam /
analyzed: pitrā te girirājena purā himavatā svayam
translated: In ancient times, your father, the king of mountains, the Himalayas himself,

original: mama priyamidaṃ sthānaṃ jñātvā liṅgaṃ pratiṣṭhitam // / //
analyzed: mama priyam idam sthānam jñātvā liṅgam pratiṣṭhitam
translated: Knowing this to be a beloved place of mine, installed a linga.

analyzed: śaileśvaram iti khyātam dṛśyatām idam āsthitam
translated: Known as Shaileshwara, see it established here.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā idam manujaḥ devi na durgatim anuvrajet
translated: O Goddess, a man who sees this will never go to a wretched state.

analyzed: nadī vārāṇasī ca iyam puṇyā pāpa pramocanī
translated: This river Varanasi is sacred and liberates from sin.

original: kṣetrametadalaṃkṛtya jāhnavyā saha saṃgatā // / //🔽sthāpitaṃ saṃgame cāsmin brahmaṇā liṅgamuttamam /
analyzed: kṣetram etat alaṃkṛtya jāhnavyā saha saṃgatā  sthāpitam saṃgame ca asmin brahmaṇā liṅgam uttamam
translated: Adorning this field, it has joined with the Jahnavi.🔽At this confluence, an excellent linga has been installed by Brahma.

analyzed: saṃgameśvaram iti evam khyātam jagati dṛśyatām
translated: Known as Sangameshvara, see it renowned in the world.

original: saṃgame devanadyostu yaḥ snātvā manujaḥ śuciḥ /
analyzed: saṃgame deva nadyoḥ tu yaḥ snātvā manujaḥ śuciḥ
translated: A pure man who bathes at the confluence of the divine rivers,

analyzed: arcayet saṃgameśānam tasya janma bhayam kutas
translated: How can there be fear of birth for him who worships Sangamesha?

analyzed: idam anyat mahat kṣetram nivāsam yoginām param
translated: This is another great holy place, the supreme abode of yogis.

original: kṣetramadhye ca yatrāhaṃ svayaṃ bhūtvā samāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: kṣetra madhye ca yatra aham svayam bhūtvā samāsthitaḥ
translated: And where I myself have become and remained in the middle of the holy place,

analyzed: madhyameśvaraḥ iti evam khyātaḥ sarva sura asuraiḥ
translated: Known as Madhyameshvara by all gods and demons.

analyzed: siddhānām sthānam etat hi madīya vrata cāriṇām
translated: This is the abode of the Siddhas who observe my vows,

analyzed: yoginām mokṣa lipsūnām janma mṛtyu jita ātmanām
translated: Of yogis who desire liberation, whose souls have conquered birth and death.

original: dṛṣṭvedaṃ madhyameśānaṃ janma prati na śocati // / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā idam madhyameśānam janma prati na śocati
translated: Having seen this Madhyameshvara, one does not grieve for birth again.

analyzed: sthāpitam liṅgam etat ca śukreṇa tava sūnunā
translated: And this Linga was installed by Shukra, your son,

analyzed: nāmnā śukreśvaram nāma sarva siddha amara arcitam
translated: Named Shukresvara, worshipped by all the Siddhas and immortals.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā idam mānavaḥ sadyas muktaḥ syāt sarva kilbiṣaiḥ
translated: Having seen this, a man would be immediately liberated from all sins.

original: mṛtaśca na punarjanma saṃsāre tu labhennaraḥ // / //
analyzed: mṛtaḥ ca na punarjanma saṃsāre tu labhet naraḥ
translated: And having died, a man would not obtain birth again in the world.

analyzed: purā jambuka rūpeṇa asurāḥ deva kaṇṭakāḥ
translated: In ancient times, the demons, thorns to the gods, in the form of Jambus,

analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ tha varam labdhvā gomāyu vadha śaṅkitāḥ
translated: Having obtained a boon from Brahma, fearing the killing of jackals,

analyzed: nihatāḥ himavat putri jambukeśaḥ tatas hi aham
translated: Were killed, O daughter of the Himalayas, and I became Jambukesha.

analyzed: abhavam jagati khyātaḥ sura asura namaskṛtaḥ
translated: I became famous in the world, revered by gods and demons.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā enam api deveśam sarva kāmān avāpnuyāt
translated: By seeing this Lord of gods, one would obtain all desires.

analyzed: grahaiḥ śukra purogaiḥ ca etāni sthāpitāni hi
translated: These have been established by the planets headed by Shukra.

analyzed: paśya liṅgāni puṇyāni sarva kāma pradāni tu
translated: See these auspicious lingas, which grant all desires.

analyzed: evam etāni puṇyāni mad nivāsāni pārvati
translated: Thus, O Parvati, these auspicious places of my residence

original: kathitāni tava kṣetre guhyaṃ cānyadidaṃ śṛṇu // / //
analyzed: kathitāni tava kṣetre guhyam ca anyat idam śṛṇu
translated: have been told to you in your holy place. Listen to this other secret.

analyzed: krośam krośam catur dikṣu kṣetram etat prakīrtitam
translated: This holy place is proclaimed to be one krosha in each of the four directions.

analyzed: yojanam viddhi cāru aṅgi mṛtyu kāle mṛta pradam
translated: Know it to be one yojana, O beautiful-bodied one, which grants immortality at the time of death.

analyzed: mahālaya giri sthāne kedāre ca vyavasthitam
translated: Situated in the place of Mahalaya mountain and in Kedara,

analyzed: gaṇa tvam labhate dṛṣṭvā kṣetre smin mokṣam āpyate
translated: one attains the state of a Gaṇa by seeing it, and liberation is attained in this holy place.

analyzed: gāṇapatya padāt tasmāt yatas sā muktiḥ uttamā
translated: From that state of Gaṇapati, since that is the highest liberation,

analyzed: tatas mahālayāt tasmāt kedārāt madhyamāt api
translated: therefore, from that Mahālaya, from Kedāra, and from Madhyama,

analyzed: smṛtam puṇyatamam kṣetram avimuktam idam śubhe
translated: this holy place Avimukta is remembered as the most meritorious and auspicious, O beautiful one.

analyzed: kedāra madhyame sthāne sthānam ca eva mahālayam
translated: In the middle place of Kedāra, and also in Mahālaya,

original: mama puṇyāni bhūrloke tebhyaḥ śreṣṭhatamaṃ tvidam // / //
analyzed: mama puṇyāni bhūrloke tebhyaḥ śreṣṭhatamam tu idam
translated: Among all the holy places on earth, this is the most excellent.

original: yataḥ sṛṣṭāni lokāni tataḥ kṣetramidaṃ śubham /
analyzed: yatas sṛṣṭāni lokāni tatas kṣetram idam śubham
translated: From where the worlds were created, this is the auspicious holy place.

analyzed: kadācid na mayā muktam avimuktam tatas bhavat
translated: It has never been abandoned by me, hence it became Avimukta.

analyzed: avimukteśvaram liṅgam mama dṛṣṭvā iha mānavaḥ
translated: A man who sees the Avimukteshvara Linga here,

analyzed: sadyas pāpa vinirmuktaḥ paśu pāśaiḥ vimucyate
translated: Immediately becomes free from sin and is liberated from the bonds of worldly existence.

analyzed: śaileśam saṃgameśam ca svarlīnam madhyameśvaram
translated: The lord of mountains, the lord of the confluence, the one merged in heaven, the lord of the middle,

analyzed: hiraṇyagarbham īśānam go prekṣam sa vṛṣa dhvajam
translated: The golden embryo, the lord, the one watching the cows, the one with the bull-banner,

analyzed: upaśānta śivam ca eva jyeṣṭhasthāna nivāsinam
translated: The one who is peaceful and auspicious, the one residing in the highest place,

analyzed: śukreśvaram ca vikhyātam vyāghreśam jambukeśvaram
translated: The famous Shukresha, the lord of tigers, the lord of jackals -

original: dṛṣṭvā na jāyate martyaḥ saṃsāre duḥkhasāgare // / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā na jāyate martyaḥ saṃsāre duḥkha sāgare
translated: By seeing these, a mortal is not born in the world, in the ocean of suffering.

analyzed: evam uktvā mahādevaḥ diśaḥ sarvāḥ vyalokayat
translated: Having said this, Mahadeva looked in all directions.

analyzed: vilokya saṃsthite paścāt devadeve maheśvare
translated: When Maheshvara, the god of gods, stood looking,

analyzed: akasmāt abhavat sarvam tat deśam jvalitam yathā
translated: Suddenly everything in that region became ablaze,

analyzed: sa vidyut stanitā ghoṣam sūrya ayuta śata uditam
translated: With lightning and the sound of thunder, shining like a hundred thousand suns.

analyzed: tejobhiḥ ekatas pūrṇam vahni bhāskarayoḥ iva
translated: Filled with splendor, like the fire and the sun together.

analyzed: tatas pāśupatāḥ siddhāḥ bhasma abhyaṅga sita prabhāḥ
translated: Then the Pashupatas, the Siddhas, anointed with ashes, shining white,

analyzed: yogi īśvarāḥ mahātmānaḥ tathā vaitānika vratāḥ
translated: The lords of yoga, the great souls, and those of Vedic vows,

analyzed: avyakta liṅginaḥ ca eva śiva yoga ujjvala prabhāḥ
translated: And those with unmanifest signs, blazing with the yoga of Shiva,

analyzed: bahavaḥ śataśas bhyetya namaścakruḥ maheśvaram
translated: Many hundreds approached and bowed to Maheshvara.

analyzed: punar nirīkṣya deveśam dhyāna yogam ca kṛtsnaśas
translated: Again, beholding the Lord of the gods and the entire yoga of meditation,

analyzed: tasthuḥ ātmānam ādhāya līyamānāḥ iva īśvare
translated: They stood, having placed their souls, as if dissolving into Shiva.

original: sthitānāṃ sa tathā teṣāṃ devadeva umāpatiḥ /
analyzed: sthitānām sa tathā teṣām devadevaḥ umāpatiḥ
translated: To those who stood thus, the Lord of the gods, the consort of Uma,

original: saṃcintya paramāṃ mūrtiṃ babhūva puruṣaḥ prabhuḥ // / //
analyzed: saṃcintya paramām mūrtim babhūva puruṣaḥ prabhuḥ
translated: Having contemplated his supreme form, became the lord Purusha.

analyzed: ṣaḍviṃśaḥ īśvaraḥ vyaktaḥ sūrya ayuta sama prabhaḥ
translated: The twenty-sixth, the unmanifest lord, shining with the brilliance of ten thousand suns,

original: kṛtsnaṃ jagadivaikasthaṃ kartumanta ivāsthitaḥ // / //🔽tasya tāṃ paramāṃ mūrtim āsthitasya jagatprabhoḥ /
analyzed: kṛtsnam jagat iva ekastham kartum antaḥ iva āsthitaḥ  tasya tām paramām mūrtim āsthitasya jagatprabhoḥ
translated: Seeming to be intent on creating the entire world as if in one place.🔽The daughter of the lord of mountains, her hair standing on end, was unable to behold the form

analyzed: na śaśāka vapuḥ draṣṭum hṛṣṭa romā girīndrajā
translated: Of that lord of the world who had assumed that supreme form.

analyzed: tatas tat sṛṣṭam ātmānam buddhvā sā prakṛti sthitam
translated: Then, knowing that his own self had been created and was abiding in Prakriti,

analyzed: prakṛteḥ mūrtim āsthāya yogena parama ātmikā
translated: Assuming the form of Prakṛti, by means of Yoga, which is of the nature of the Supreme Self,

analyzed: tam śaśāka vapuḥ draṣṭum puruṣasya parātmanaḥ

analyzed: śirasi añjalim ādhāya tuṣṭuvuḥ sahitāḥ samam
translated: Joining their palms over their heads, they praised together in unison.

original: namaḥ siddhyai namastuṣṭyai kriyāyai buddhaye namaḥ /🔽namaḥ kīrtyai namaḥ satyai ulkajāyai tatheṣṭaye // / //
analyzed: namaḥ siddhyai namaḥ tuṣṭyai kriyāyai buddhaye namaḥ  namaḥ kīrtyai namaḥ satyai ulkajāyai tathā iṣṭaye
translated: Salutations to Siddhi, to Tushti, to Kriya, to Buddhi.🔽Salutations to Kirti, to Satya, to Ulkaja, and to Ishtya.

original: namaḥ pṛthivyai kalyāṇyai śriyai lakṣmyai namo namaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ pṛthivyai kalyāṇyai śriyai lakṣmyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Prithvi, to Kalyani, to Shri, to Lakshmi, again and again.

original: namaḥ sudhāyai svāhāyai svadhāyai ditaye namaḥ // / //
analyzed: namaḥ sudhāyai svāhāyai svadhāyai ditaye namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Sudha, to Svaha, to Svadha, to Diti.

original: namo 'stu taḍite caiva saudāmanyai namo namaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ stu taḍite ca eva saudāmanyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Tadita, to Saudamini, again and again.

original: sāvitryai cātha gāyatryai vedamātre namo namaḥ // / //
analyzed: sāvitryai ca atha gāyatryai vedamātre namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Savitri, to Gayatri, to the mere Vedas, again and again.

analyzed: namaḥ parvatakanyāyai mataye smṛtaye namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the daughter of the mountain, to Mati, to Smriti.

original: namaḥ parvatavāsinyai rudrāṇyai ca namo namaḥ // / //
analyzed: namaḥ parvata vāsinyai rudrāṇyai ca namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the dweller of the mountain, to Rudrani, again and again.

original: namaḥ prakṛtaye caiva jyotsnāyai ṛddhaye namaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ prakṛtaye ca eva jyotsnāyai ṛddhaye namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Prakriti, to Jyotisna, to Rddhi.

original: śobhāyai dīptaye caiva bhāskaragraharaśmaye // / //🔽gatyāyai gataye caiva indrāṇyai muktaye namaḥ /
analyzed: śobhāyai dīptaye ca eva bhāskara graha raśmaye  gatyāyai gataye ca eva indrāṇyai muktaye namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Shobhaya, to Dipta, to the rays of the sun and planets.🔽Salutations to Gati, to Gati, to Indrani, to Mukti.

original: niyatyai sarite caiva gaṅgāyai sūtaye namaḥ // / //
analyzed: niyatyai sarite ca eva gaṅgāyai sūtaye namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Niyati, to the river, to Ganga, to Suta.

analyzed: hetaye prītaye ca eva namaḥ karaṇa vṛttaye
translated: Salutations to the cause, to the delight, and to the functioning of the senses.

original: namaḥ saṃnataye caiva irāyai vṛttaye namaḥ // / //🔽vāruṇyai ca śaraṇyāyai gauryai kālyai namo namaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ saṃnataye ca eva irāyai vṛttaye namaḥ  vāruṇyai ca śaraṇyāyai gauryai kālyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the bent one, to the nourishment, and to the conduct.🔽Salutations to Varuṇa's wife, to the one who grants refuge, to Gaurī, to Kālī, again and again.

original: kauśikyai ca namaste 'stu kātyāyanyai namo namaḥ // / //
analyzed: kauśikyai ca namaḥ te stu kātyāyanyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, Kauśikī, and to you, Kātyāyanī, again and again.

original: namaḥ saṃnataye caiva mahimne ca namo namaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ saṃnataye ca eva mahimne ca namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the bent one, and again and again salutations to greatness.

analyzed: aṇimāyai namaḥ te stu laghimāyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, Aṇimā, and salutations to you, Laghimā, again and again.

original: pūjāyai te namaste 'stu śitibāhve ca sṛptaye /
analyzed: pūjāyai te namaḥ te stu śiti bāhve ca sṛptaye
translated: Salutations to you, Pūjā, and to Śitibāhu, and to Sṛpta.

original: saṃjñāyai ca namaste 'stu gire 'tha smṛtaye namaḥ // / //
analyzed: saṃjñāyai ca namaḥ te stu gire smṛtaye namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Saṃjñā, and to you, Giri, and to Smṛti, again and again.

original: namaste 'stu sarasvatyai jihvāyai dṛṣṭaye namaḥ /🔽namo mahiṣaghātinyai tathā sumbhanisumbhayoḥ // / //🔽namaḥ siṃharathinyai ca śūlinyai ca namo namaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ te stu sarasvatyai jihvāyai dṛṣṭaye namaḥ  namaḥ mahiṣaghātinyai tathā sumbha nisumbhayoḥ  namaḥ siṃharathinyai ca śūlinyai ca namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, Sarasvatī, to Jihvā, and to Dṛṣṭi.🔽Salutations to the slayer of Mahiṣa, and to Sumbha and Niśumbha.🔽Salutations to the one with a lion chariot, and to the trident-holder, again and again.

analyzed: namaḥ mudgara dhāriṇyai kavacinyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the wielder of the mace, and to the one clad in armor, again and again.

analyzed: namaḥ tūṇīra dhāriṇyai dhāriṇyai jagataḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the one who holds quivers, and to the sustainer of the world.

original: namo dhanurdharāyai ca khaḍginyai ca namo namaḥ // / //
analyzed: namaḥ dhanurdharāyai ca khaḍginyai ca namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the wielder of the bow, and to the sword-bearer, again and again.

original: namaḥ piñcchadhvajinyai ca dhāriṇyai paṭṭisasya ca /
analyzed: namaḥ piñccha dhvajinyai ca dhāriṇyai paṭṭisasya ca
translated: Salutations to the banner of Pincha, to the bearer of the spear,

original: namo 'stu bhūtamātre ca skandasya ca namo namaḥ // / //
analyzed: namaḥ stu bhūtamātre ca skandasya ca namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the mere being, to Skanda, salutations again and again.

analyzed: viśākha śākhayoḥ ca eva naigameṣasya ca eva hi
translated: To Vishakha and Shakha, and also to Naigamésha,

original: jātyai sarvarasānāṃ ca devatāyai vanasya ca // / //🔽āryāyai ca namo nityaṃ śikhaṇḍinyai namo namaḥ /
analyzed: jātyai sarva rasānām ca devatāyai vanasya ca  āryāyai ca namaḥ nityam śikhaṇḍinyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: To the birth of all tastes, to the deity of the forest, salutations again and again.🔽Salutations always to the noble one, to Shikhandin, salutations again and again.

analyzed: namaḥ nīlaśikhaṇḍinyai dīrghaveṇyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Nila-shikhandin, to Dirgha-venya, salutations again and again.

original: namo 'stu tanumadhyāyai devatāyai dhanasya ca /🔽namo dhṛtyai namaścityai kīrtaye ca namo namaḥ // / //
analyzed: namaḥ stu tanu madhyāyai devatāyai dhanasya ca  namaḥ dhṛtyai namaḥ cityai kīrtaye ca namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the deity of wealth with a slender waist.🔽Salutations to patience, to fortitude, to fame, salutations again and again.

original: strīṇāṃ saubhāgyadāyinyai dhāriṇyai ca namo namaḥ /
analyzed: strīṇām saubhāgya dāyinyai dhāriṇyai ca namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the bestower of conjugal bliss to women, to the bearer, salutations again and again.

analyzed: rākā anumataye ca eva sinīvālyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the one approved by the night, to Sinivāli, salutations again and again.

original: namaḥ kriyāyai śraddhāyai medhāyai ca namo namaḥ /🔽namo 'stu dhāraṇāyai ca ūhāyai ca namo namaḥ // / //🔽apohāyai namaste 'stu vaṣaṭprakṛtaye namaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ kriyāyai śraddhāyai medhāyai ca namaḥ namaḥ  namaḥ stu dhāraṇāyai ca ūhāyai ca namaḥ namaḥ  apohāyai namaḥ te stu vaṣaṭ prakṛtaye namaḥ
translated: Salutations to action, to faith, to intelligence, salutations again and again.🔽Salutations to the one who holds, to the one who infers, salutations again and again.🔽Salutations to you, to the one who rejects, salutations to the one who is the basis of Vaṣaṭkāra.

original: namaḥ samādhaye caiva spṛhāyai vittaye namaḥ // / //
analyzed: namaḥ samādhaye ca eva spṛhāyai vittaye namaḥ
translated: Salutations to concentration, to the one who touches, to the one who gives wealth, salutations again and again.

analyzed: vedanāyai namaḥ te stu bṛhadukṣyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, O feeling, O great milker, salutations again and again.

original: namaḥ prabhāyai śuddhāyai śuddhaye śucaye namaḥ // / //🔽namastryambakabhāryāyai vidyāyai ca namo namaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ prabhāyai śuddhāyai śuddhaye śucaye namaḥ  namaḥ tryambaka bhāryāyai vidyāyai ca namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the radiant, pure, and pure one.🔽Salutations to the wife of the three-eyed one, and to knowledge, again and again.

original: dīkṣāyai dakṣiṇāyai ca jvālāyai ca namo namaḥ // / //
analyzed: dīkṣāyai dakṣiṇāyai ca jvālāyai ca namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to initiation, to the southern direction, and to the flame, again and again.

original: indriyāṇāṃ pravṛttyai ca nivṛttyai caiva karmaṇām /
analyzed: indriyāṇām pravṛttyai ca nivṛttyai ca eva karmaṇām
translated: To the engagement of the senses and to the disengagement of actions,

original: śrutaye sarvavedānāṃ bhavānyai ca namo namaḥ // / //
analyzed: śrutaye sarva vedānām bhavānyai ca namaḥ namaḥ
translated: To the hearing of all the Vedas, and to the wife of Bhava, salutations again and again.

analyzed: durgāyai durga tāriṇyai dhāriṇyai sarva dehinām
translated: To Durga, the destroyer of misfortune, and to the supporter of all embodied beings,

analyzed: namaḥ te sarva devatyai namaḥ te loka bhāvani
translated: Salutations to you, the deity of all, salutations to you, the creator of the worlds.

original: namaḥ śāntyai namaḥ kāntyai namaḥ patnyai harasya ca /
analyzed: namaḥ śāntyai namaḥ kāntyai namaḥ patnyai harasya ca
translated: Salutations to peace, salutations to beauty, salutations to the wife of Hara.

analyzed: namaḥ stu adityai dānavyai vinatāyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Aditi, the wife of Dāna, and to Vinatā, again and again.

original: namaḥ śivāyai kartryai ca prabhāvāyai namo namaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ śivāyai kartryai ca prabhāvāyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the auspicious, to the creator, and to the powerful, again and again.

original: mṛkaṇḍvai mārdabāhvai ca tathā surataye namaḥ // / //
analyzed: mṛkaṇḍvai mārdabāhvai ca tathā surataye namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Mṛkaṇḍu, to Mārda, to Bāhu, and likewise to Sura, again and again.

original: vinatāyai tathā lakṣmyai surasāyai namo namaḥ /
analyzed: vinatāyai tathā lakṣmyai surasāyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Vinatā, to Lakṣmī, and to Surasa, again and again.

analyzed: namaḥ te śitikaṇṭhinyai namaḥ te sarvatas sadā
translated: Salutations to you, O blue-throated one, salutations to you always from all sides.

original: diśa naḥ sumanāḥ sarvaṃ yatkiṃciddhṛdaye sthitam // / //
analyzed: diśa naḥ sumanāḥ sarvam yat kiṃcid hṛdaye sthitam
translated: Grant us all that is in our heart, with a benevolent mind.

analyzed: sanatkumāraḥ uvāca
translated: Sanatkumara said:

original: ya idaṃ paṭhate nityaṃ naraḥ strī vā samāhitaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ idam paṭhate nityam naraḥ strī vā samāhitaḥ
translated: The man or woman who recites this daily with a focused mind,

analyzed: sa rātriṣu kṛtam pāpam tyajet sarvam aśeṣatas
translated: Will be freed from all the sins committed during the night, without exception.

original: śayāno japate yaśca prayato vyāsa nityaśaḥ /
analyzed: śayānaḥ japate yaḥ ca prayataḥ vyāsa nityaśas
translated: O Vyasa, the one who recites this with purity while lying down every day,

original: divākṛtaṃ sa jahyāttu mṛtaśca sugatiṃ vrajet // / //
analyzed: divākṛtam sa jahyāt tu mṛtaḥ ca sugatim vrajet
translated: Will be freed from the sins committed during the day and will attain a good state after death.

analyzed: yaḥ ca etat śṛṇuyāt nityam dvijān vā śrāvayet sadā
translated: The one who listens to this daily or always recites it to Brahmins,

analyzed: sa dehabhedam āsādya pañcacūḍā priyaḥ bhavet
translated: Will attain a state of bliss upon the dissolution of the body, dear to the five-crested one.

original: yaścainaṃ prajahanprāṇāñ japenmartyaḥ sudustyajān /🔽vimāne sūryasaṃkāśe apsarogaṇasevite /
analyzed: yaḥ ca enam prajahan prāṇām japet martyaḥ su dustyajān  vimāne sūrya saṃkāśe apsaraḥ gaṇa sevite
translated: The mortal who recites this while giving up his life, which is very difficult to abandon,🔽In a chariot resembling the sun, attended by groups of celestial nymphs,

original: sarvapāpavinirmukto ramedvarṣāyutaṃ samam // / //🔽yaśca bhaktyā paramayā tithau niyamavānnaraḥ /
analyzed: sarva pāpa vinirmuktaḥ ramet varṣa ayutam samam  yaḥ ca bhaktyā paramayā tithau niyamavān naraḥ
translated: Freed from all sins, he will enjoy for ten thousand years.

original: devīmabhyarcya japate sarvapāpaiḥ pramucyate // / //🔽japanāddehatapanād dehe bhinne ca bhaktimān /
analyzed: devīm abhyarcya japate sarva pāpaiḥ pramucyate  japanāt deha tapanāt dehe bhinne ca bhaktimān
translated: The man who, with supreme devotion, worships the Goddess on the lunar day and recites this, is freed from all sins.🔽By reciting this, by purifying the body, and by remaining devoted to the Goddess even after the body is dissolved,

original: sa bhūtvānucaro devyāḥ puṇye loke mahīyate // / //
analyzed: sa bhūtvā anucaraḥ devyāḥ puṇye loke mahīyate
translated: He becomes an attendant of the Goddess and is honored in the sacred world.

analyzed: sanatkumāraḥ uvāca
translated: Sanatkumara said:

original: tābhirevaṃ stutā devī sthitā devasya saṃnidhau /
analyzed: tābhiḥ evam stutā devī sthitā devasya saṃnidhau
translated: The goddess, thus praised by them, stood in the presence of the god.

analyzed: uvāca harṣamāṇa āsyā pañcacūḍāḥ tadā vacaḥ
translated: With a delighted face, she then spoke to the Panchachuda Apsaras:

analyzed: śṛṇuta apsarasaḥ sarvāḥ tapasaḥ sya mahat phalam
translated: Listen, all you Apsaras, to the great fruit of this penance.

original: yaccāpi parayā bhaktyā māṃ prapannāḥ stha śobhanāḥ // / //
analyzed: yat ca api parayā bhaktyā mām prapannāḥ stha śobhanāḥ
translated: And since you beautiful ones have come to me with supreme devotion,

analyzed: ajarāḥ ca viśokāḥ ca nityam mudita mānasāḥ
translated: you will be free from old age and sorrow, always cheerful in mind,

analyzed: priyāḥ ca sarva lokasya bhaviṣyatha mama ājñayā
translated: and dear to all the world, by my command.

analyzed: brūta yat ca api kiṃcid vaḥ hṛdi sthitam aśaṅkitāḥ
translated: Tell me without hesitation whatever is in your hearts.

original: sarvaṃ dāsyāmi tadvo 'haṃ mā cirāya taducyatām // / //
analyzed: sarvam dāsyāmi tat vaḥ ham mā cirāya tat ucyatām
translated: I will give you all that. Speak without delay.

analyzed: pañcacūḍāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The Panchachuda Apsaras said:

original: devi puṃsāṃ striyaḥ sarvāḥ kāryārthaṃ viditaṃ ca te /🔽arthinaste ca nastāvad yāvatkāryaṃ samāpyate /
analyzed: devi puṃsām striyaḥ sarvāḥ kārya artham viditam ca te  arthinaḥ te ca naḥ tāvat yāvat kāryam samāpyate
translated: O goddess, all women are known to men for the sake of work.🔽And they are our suitors as long as the work is completed.

original: samāpte caiva tatkārye parā iva bhavanti naḥ // / //
analyzed: samāpte ca eva tad kārye parāḥ iva bhavanti naḥ
translated: But when that work is finished, they become indifferent to us.

original: taddevi yadi tuṣṭāsi yadi deyo varaśca naḥ /
analyzed: tat devi yadi tuṣṭā asi yadi deyaḥ varaḥ ca naḥ
translated: O goddess, if you are pleased, if you are to grant us a boon,

analyzed: sarva strīṇām mahādevi bhavantu puruṣāḥ vaśāḥ
translated: O great goddess, let all men be under the control of women.

analyzed: devī uvāca
translated: The goddess said:

analyzed: adya prabhṛti lokeṣu sarva strīṇām narāḥ sadā
translated: From today onwards, all men in the worlds will always be under the control of all women,

original: sarve vaśyā bhaviṣyanti sarvakāryakarāśca ha // / //🔽ādau paścācca sarvābhyo hiraṇyaṃ paśavaḥ striyaḥ /
analyzed: sarve vaśyāḥ bhaviṣyanti sarva kārya karāḥ ca ha  ādau paścāt ca sarvābhyaḥ hiraṇyam paśavaḥ striyaḥ
translated: and will do everything that is to be done.🔽 At the beginning and end, let them give gold, cattle, women,

analyzed: sarva bhogān ca dāsyantu vaśagāḥ sarvathā api ca
translated: and all enjoyments to all, being completely under control, even in every way.

analyzed: vyalīkāni api kurvantyaḥ bahūni vividhāni ca
translated: Even if they commit many kinds of wrongs,

original: priyā eva bhaviṣyanti pāpaṃ na ca bhavetsadā // / //🔽mātaraṃ pitaraṃ bhrātṝn suhṛdo 'tha sutānapi /
analyzed: priyāḥ eva bhaviṣyanti pāpam na ca bhavet sadā  mātaram pitaram bhrātṝn suhṛdaḥ sutān api
translated: they will always be dear, and no sin will occur.🔽 Let them do improper things to mothers, fathers, brothers, friends, and even sons,

analyzed: akāryāṇi kariṣyantu strīṇām vaśya tvam āgatāḥ
translated: having come under the control of women.

analyzed: paśyantaḥ vyalīkāni doṣān vaikṛtyam eva ca
translated: Even if they see wrongs, faults, and perversions,

analyzed: nā eva drakṣyanti te puṃsaḥ mad varāt mohita indriyāḥ
translated: those men, their senses deluded by my boon, will not see at all.

analyzed: sanatkumāraḥ uvāca
translated: Sanatkumara said:

original: tataḥ sā devadevasya patnī himavataḥ sutā /
analyzed: tatas sā devadevasya patnī himavataḥ sutā
translated: Then the wife of the god of gods, the daughter of Himavat,

analyzed: mālya dāmam gṛhītvā tu bhrāmayantī śubha ānanā
translated: taking a garland of flowers, whirling it with her beautiful face,

original: bhava nārya iti prāha hasantī priyamavyayā // / //
analyzed: bhava nāryaḥ iti prāha hasantī priyam avyayā
translated: laughing and saying to her beloved, the imperishable one, O Bhava's wife,

analyzed: bhrāmyataḥ tasya dāmnaḥ tu yāni aśīryanta bhū tale
translated: of that garland which was whirling, those which fell on the ground,

analyzed: kusumāni abhavan tāni nāryaḥ kamala locanāḥ
translated: Those flowers became women with eyes like lotus petals.

analyzed: tāḥ uvāca amarāḥ yūyam jarā kṣaya vivarjitāḥ
translated: He said to them, You are immortal, free from old age and destruction.

analyzed: jagat moha karāḥ yūyam puṃsām hṛdaya bandhanāḥ
translated: You are the enchanters of the world, the bonds of men's hearts.

analyzed: dṛṣṭi sparśa vilāseṣu āviśya jagati striyaḥ
translated: Having entered into the delights of sight and touch in the world, O women,

analyzed: saṃmohayiṣyatha narān strī vaśān ca kariṣyatha
translated: you will enchant men and bring them under the control of women.

original: narāḥ sarve ca yuṣmāsu bhaviṣyanti sadā ratāḥ // / //
analyzed: narāḥ sarve ca yuṣmāsu bhaviṣyanti sadā ratāḥ
translated: All men will always be devoted to you.

original: vṛttiḥ śubhā bhavitrī ca sarvāsāṃ mama tejasā /
analyzed: vṛttiḥ śubhā bhavitrī ca sarvāsām mama tejasā
translated: Your livelihood will be pure, all of you, by my power.

analyzed: puṃsām strī bhoga siddhi artham strīṇām rati artham eva ca
translated: For the sake of men's attainment of the enjoyment of women, and for the sake of women's pleasure itself,

original: kriyāḥ śubhāṅgasaṃskārā divyā ye mānuṣāśca ha /
analyzed: kriyāḥ śubha aṅga saṃskārāḥ divyāḥ ye mānuṣāḥ ca ha
translated: The auspicious rites of divine and human consecration of the limbs,

analyzed: bahu rūpāḥ ca tāḥ bhūtvā viviśuḥ sarvadā aṅganāḥ
translated: having become multi-formed, all the women always entered.

analyzed: sanatkumāraḥ uvāca
translated: Sanatkumara said

original: evaṃ devī tadā vyāsa sṛṣṭvā tā vai visṛjya ca /🔽uvācāpsaraso brūta kiṃ vo bhūyaḥ karomyaham // / //
analyzed: evam devī tadā vyāsa sṛṣṭvā tāḥ vai visṛjya ca  uvāca apsarasaḥ brūta kim vaḥ bhūyas karomi aham
translated: Thus, O Vyasa, the Goddess then created them and dismissed them.🔽She said to the celestial nymphs, Tell me, what more can I do for you?

analyzed: tāḥ tuṣṭa manasaḥ ca api ūcuḥ vyāsa bhavemahi

original: idaṃ guhyatamaṃ kṣetraṃ sadā vārāṇasī mama /
analyzed: idam guhyatamam kṣetram sadā vārāṇasī mama
translated: This Vārāṇasī is always my most secret holy place.

analyzed: sarveṣām eva jantūnām hetuḥ mokṣasya sarvadā
translated: It is always the cause of liberation for all beings.

analyzed: asmin siddhāḥ sadā devi madīyam vratam āśritāḥ
translated: O Goddess, the Siddhas here, always following my vow,

analyzed: nānā liṅga dharāḥ nityam mama loka abhikāṅkṣiṇaḥ
translated: Always bearing various forms, always desiring my world,

analyzed: abhyasyanti param yogam yukta ātmānaḥ jita indriyāḥ
translated: Practicing the supreme yoga, with disciplined minds and conquered senses.

analyzed: nānā vṛkṣa samākīrṇe nānā vihaga sevite  kamala utpala puṣpa āḍhyaiḥ sarobhiḥ samalaṃkṛte
translated: Filled with many trees, frequented by various birds,🔽Adorned with lakes rich in lotus and water lily flowers,

analyzed: apsaraḥ gaṇa gandharvaiḥ sadā saṃsevite śubhe
translated: Always frequented by hosts of celestial nymphs and gandharvas, in a beautiful place.

original: rocate me sadāvāso yena kāryeṇa tacchṛṇu // / //
analyzed: rocate me sadā āvāsaḥ yena kāryeṇa tat śṛṇu
translated: I always delight in dwelling there. Listen to the reason why.

analyzed: mad manāḥ mama bhaktaḥ ca mayi sarva arpita kriyaḥ
translated: One who is devoted to me, who is a devotee of mine, who has dedicated all actions to me,

original: yathā mokṣamihāpnoti anyatra na tathā kvacit // / //
analyzed: yathā mokṣam iha āpnoti anyatra na tathā kvacid
translated: Attains liberation here, not so easily elsewhere.

analyzed: etat mama puram divyam guhyāt guhyataram mahat
translated: This is my divine city, the most secret of secrets.

original: brahmādayo vijānanti ye ca siddhā mumukṣavaḥ /
analyzed: brahma ādayaḥ vijānanti ye ca siddhāḥ mumukṣavaḥ
translated: Brahma and others know it, as well as the liberated ones seeking liberation.

analyzed: atas priyam idam kṣetram asmāt ca iha ratiḥ mama
translated: Therefore, this is my beloved field, and I take delight in it.

original: vimuktaṃ na mayā yasmān mokṣyate vā kadācana /
analyzed: vimuktam na mayā yasmāt mokṣyate vā kadācana
translated: Since it is not abandoned by me, nor will it ever be,

analyzed: mama kṣetram idam tasmāt avimuktam iti smṛtam
translated: My field is known as Avimukta (never abandoned).

analyzed: naimiśe tha kurukṣetre gaṅgādvāre tha puṣkare
translated: In Naimisha, Kurukshetra, Gangadvara, and Pushkara,

analyzed: snānāt saṃsevanāt vā api na mokṣaḥ prāpyate yatas
translated: Liberation is not attained either through bathing or service.

analyzed: iha samprāpyate yena tatas etat viśiṣyate
translated: By attaining which, it is superior to that.

original: prayāge vā bhavenmokṣa iha vā matparigrahāt /
analyzed: prayāge vā bhavet mokṣaḥ iha vā mad parigrahāt
translated: Or liberation may be attained at Prayaga, or here through my grace.

analyzed: prayāgāt api tīrtha agryāt idam eva mahat smṛtam
translated: This is considered greater than even Prayaga, the foremost of holy places.

original: jaigīṣavyaḥ parāṃ siddhiṃ yo gataḥ sa mahātapāḥ /
analyzed: jaigīṣavyaḥ parām siddhim yaḥ gataḥ sa mahā tapāḥ
translated: That great ascetic Jaigishavya, who attained the highest perfection,

original: asya kṣetrasya māhātmyād bhaktyā ca mama bhāvataḥ // / //
analyzed: asya kṣetrasya māhātmyāt bhaktyā ca mama bhāvataḥ
translated: By the greatness of this holy place and through devotion to me,

analyzed: jaigīṣavya guhā śreṣṭhā yoginām sthānam iṣyate
translated: The cave of Jaigishavya is considered the best place for yogis.

analyzed: dhyāyataḥ tatra mām nityam yoga agniḥ dīpyate bhṛśam
translated: The fire of yoga blazes intensely there, as I am always meditated upon.

analyzed: kaivalyam paramam yāti devānām api durlabham
translated: One attains the highest liberation, difficult to obtain even for the gods.

analyzed: avyakta liṅgaiḥ munibhiḥ sarva siddhānta vedibhiḥ
translated: By the sages who bear the invisible linga, who know all the conclusions,

analyzed: iha samprāpyate mokṣaḥ durlabhaḥ nyatra karhicit
translated: Liberation is attained here, which is difficult to obtain elsewhere.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ ca aham prayacchāmi yoga aiśvaryam anuttamam
translated: And to them, I grant the supreme mastery of yoga,

analyzed: ātmanaḥ ca eva sāyujyam īpsitam sthānam eva ca
translated: And the union with me, and the desired abode.

analyzed: kuberaḥ sa mahā yakṣaḥ tathā sarva arpita kriyaḥ
translated: That great Yaksha Kubera, who has entrusted all his actions to me,

analyzed: kṣetra saṃsevanāt devi gaṇeśa tvam avāpa ha
translated: Attained the lordship of the Ganas by serving this holy place.

original: saṃvarto bhavitā yaśca so 'pi bhaktyā mamaiva tu /
analyzed: saṃvartaḥ bhavitā yaḥ ca bhaktyā mama eva tu
translated: And the one who will be the future Saṃvarta, he too is devoted to me alone.

analyzed: iha eva ārādhya mām devi siddhim yāsyati anuttamām
translated: O Goddess, having worshipped me here itself, he will attain the highest perfection.

analyzed: parāśara sutaḥ yogī ṛṣiḥ vyāsaḥ mahā tapāḥ
translated: The sage Vyāsa, the son of Parāśara, a great ascetic, a yogi,

analyzed: dharma vaktā bhaviṣyaḥ ca veda saṃsthā pravartakaḥ
translated: the expounder of dharma, and the promulgator of the Vedic system,

analyzed: raṃsyate saḥ pi padma akṣi kṣetre smin muni puṃgavaḥ
translated: that great sage, O lotus-eyed one, will enjoy himself in this very holy place.

analyzed: brahmā devarṣibhiḥ sārdham viṣṇuḥ vāyuḥ divākaraḥ
translated: Brahmā along with the celestial sages, Viṣṇu, Vāyu, Divākara,

analyzed: devarājaḥ tathā śakraḥ ye ca anye divaukasaḥ
translated: the king of gods Indra, and other dwellers of heaven,

analyzed: upāsate mahātmānaḥ sarve mām iha suvrate
translated: all these great souls, O you of good vows, worship me here.

original: anye ca yoginaḥ siddhāś channarūpā mahāvrate /
analyzed: anye ca yoginaḥ siddhāḥ channa rūpāḥ mahāvrate
translated: And other yogis and siddhas, O you of great vows, with hidden forms,

analyzed: an anya manasaḥ bhūtvā mām iha upāsate sadā
translated: with undivided minds, always worship me here.

analyzed: alarkaḥ ca purīm etām mad prasādāt avāpsyati
translated: And Alarka will obtain this city through my grace.

analyzed: sa ca enām pūrvavat kṛtvā catur varṇa samākulām
translated: And he, having made it as before, full of the four castes,

analyzed: sphītām janapada ākīrṇām bhuktvā ca su ciram nṛpaḥ
translated: having enjoyed it for a long time, the prosperous king, full of people,

analyzed: mayi sarva arpita prāṇaḥ mām eva pratipatsyate
translated: having dedicated his life to me, will attain me alone.

analyzed: tatas prabhṛti cārvaṅgi ye kṣetra nivāsinaḥ
translated: O beautiful-bodied one, from that time onwards, even those who reside in the field,

analyzed: gṛhiṇaḥ liṅginaḥ vā api mad bhaktāḥ mad parāyaṇāḥ
translated: whether householders or ascetics, who are my devotees, devoted to me,

analyzed: mad prasādāt gamiṣyanti mokṣam parama durgamam
translated: will attain liberation, which is extremely difficult to attain, by my grace.

analyzed: viṣaya āsakta cittaḥ tyakta dharma ratiḥ naraḥ
translated: Even a man whose mind is attached to objects of sense, who has abandoned the joy of dharma,

original: iha kṣetre mṛtaḥ so 'pi saṃsāraṃ na punarviśet // / //
analyzed: iha kṣetre mṛtaḥ saṃsāram na punar viśet
translated: dying here in this field, will not enter into worldly existence again.

analyzed: ye punar nirmamāḥ dhīrāḥ sattva sthāḥ vijita indriyāḥ
translated: But those who are again free from possessiveness, steadfast, with senses under control,

analyzed: vratinaḥ ca nirārambhāḥ sarvatas mayi bhāvitāḥ
translated: ascetics, free from activity, always contemplating on me,

analyzed: dehabhedam samāsādya dhīmantaḥ saṅga varjitāḥ
translated: the wise, free from attachment, attaining separation of the body,

original: gatā eva paraṃ mokṣaṃ prasādānmama suvrate // / //
analyzed: gatāḥ eva param mokṣam prasādāt mama suvrate
translated: have attained the highest liberation, O you of good vows, by my grace.

analyzed: janma antara sahasreṣu yuñjan yogī yam āpnuyāt
translated: What a yogi attains in thousands of other births by practice,

analyzed: tam iha eva param mokṣam maraṇāt adhigacchati
translated: he attains the highest liberation right here, after death.

analyzed: etat saṃkṣepataḥ devi kṣetrasya asya mahat phalam
translated: This, O Goddess, is the great fruit of this holy place,

analyzed: avimuktasya kathitam mayā te guhyam uttamam
translated: the excellent secret of Avimukta, has been told by me to you.

analyzed: atas parataram nā asti kṣetram guhyam iti īśvari
translated: Beyond this there is no other holy place, O Goddess, which is a secret.

original: etadbudhyanti yogajñā ye ca yogīśvarā bhuvi // / //
analyzed: etat budhyanti yoga jñāḥ ye ca yogi īśvarāḥ bhuvi
translated: This is understood by those who know yoga and by the lords of yoga on earth.

original: etadeva paraṃ jñānam etadeva paraṃ śivam /
analyzed: etat eva param jñānam etat eva param śivam
translated: This alone is the supreme knowledge, this alone is the supreme auspiciousness,

original: etadeva paraṃ brahma etadeva paraṃ padam // / //
analyzed: etat eva param brahma etat eva param padam
translated: this alone is the supreme Brahman, this alone is the supreme state.

original: vārāṇasīti bhuvanatrayasārabhūtā ramyā purī mama sadā girirājaputri /
analyzed: vārāṇasī iti bhuvanatraya sāra bhūtā ramyā purī mama sadā girirāja putri
translated: O daughter of the king of mountains, this city of Varanasi, which is the essence of the three worlds, is always dear to me.

analyzed: atra āgatāḥ vividha duṣkṛta kāriṇaḥ pi pāpa kṣayāt virajasaḥ pratibhānti martyāḥ
translated: Even those who have committed various evil deeds, when they come here, appear spotless due to the destruction of their sins.

analyzed: etat smṛtam priyatamam mama devi nityam kṣetram vicitra taru gulma nikāma puṣpam
translated: O Goddess, this is my most beloved and cherished holy place, always filled with beautiful trees, vines, and lovely flowers.

analyzed: asmin mṛtāḥ tanubhṛtaḥ padam āpnuvanti mokṣa ākhyam enasi ratā api na
translated: Those who die here, even if they are sinners, attain the state called liberation. There is no doubt about this.

analyzed: iti skandapurāṇe triṃśattamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirtieth chapter in the Skanda Purana.

analyzed: sanatkumāraḥ uvāca
translated: Sanatkumara said:

analyzed: etasmin antare devaḥ devīm prāha girīndrajām
translated: In the meantime, the Lord spoke to the Goddess, the daughter of the Lord of mountains:

analyzed: prayāma dātum yakṣāya varam bhaktāya bhāvini
translated: O future one, let us go to grant a boon to the Yaksha, who is a devotee.

analyzed: bhaktaḥ mama varārohe tapasā hata kilbiṣaḥ
translated: O beautiful lady, he is my devotee, his sins destroyed by austerities.

analyzed: arhaḥ varam asau labdham asmattaḥ bhuvaneśvari
translated: O Goddess of the world, he is worthy of receiving a boon from us.

original: evamuktvā tato devaḥ saha devyā jagatpatiḥ /
analyzed: evam uktvā tatas devaḥ saha devyā jagatpatiḥ
translated: Having said this, the Lord, the consort of the Goddess, the Lord of the universe,

translated: went to the place where the Yaksha was, emaciated and covered with veins.

analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā praṇatam bhaktyā harikeśam vṛṣadhvajaḥ
translated: Seeing the devoted Harikesha bowing down, the Bull-bannered One (Shiva)

analyzed: divyam cakṣuḥ adāt tasmai yena apaśyat sa śaṃkaram
translated: gave him divine vision, by which he saw Shankara.

analyzed: sanatkumāraḥ uvāca
translated: Sanatkumara said:

analyzed: atha yakṣaḥ tadā vyāsa śanais unmīlya locane
translated: Then, O Vyasa, the Yaksha slowly opening his eyes,

analyzed: apaśyat sa gaṇam devam vṛṣam ca evam upāśritam
translated: saw the God with his attendants, seated on the bull.

analyzed: devaḥ uvāca
translated: The God said:

original: balaṃ dadāni te pūrvaṃ traikālyaṃ darśanaṃ tathā /
analyzed: balam dadāni te pūrvam traikālyam darśanam tathā
translated: I grant you strength, the vision of the three times,

original: sāvarṇyaṃ ca śarīrasya paśya māṃ vigatajvaraḥ // / //
analyzed: sāvarṇyam ca śarīrasya paśya mām vigata jvaraḥ
translated: and the fairness of the body. See me, free from sorrow.

analyzed: sanatkumāraḥ uvāca
translated: Sanatkumara said:

analyzed: tatas sa labdhvā tu varam śarīreṇa akṣatena ca
translated: Then, having obtained the boon, with his body unharmed,

analyzed: pādayoḥ praṇataḥ tasthau kṛtvā śirasi ca añjalim
translated: he stood with his head bowed at the feet, his hands folded in reverence.

original: uvāca sa tadā yakṣo varado 'smīti coditaḥ /
analyzed: uvāca sa tadā yakṣaḥ vara daḥ smi iti coditaḥ
translated: When urged by the God to ask for a boon, the Yaksha said:

analyzed: bhagavan bhaktim agryām tu tvayi ananyām vidhatsva me
translated: O Lord, grant me the highest devotion to you, undivided.

analyzed: anna da tvam ca lokānām gāṇapatyam tathā akṣayam
translated: The state of being the giver of food to the people, and the imperishable status of being the chief of the Ganas.

original: avimukte ca te sthāne paśyeyaṃ sarvadā yathā /
analyzed: avimukte ca te sthāne paśyeyam sarvadā yathā
translated: And may I always see you in that place of Avimukta.

analyzed: etat icchāmi deveśa dattam varam anuttamam
translated: I desire this, O Lord of gods, grant me this excellent boon.

analyzed: devaḥ uvāca  jarā maraṇa saṃtyaktaḥ sarva śoka vivarjitaḥ
translated: The god said:🔽You will be free from old age and death, devoid of all sorrow,

analyzed: bhaviṣyasi gaṇādhyakṣaḥ vara daḥ sarva pūjitaḥ
translated: The chief of the Ganas, the giver of boons, worshipped by all,

analyzed: ajayyaḥ ca api sarveṣām yoga aiśvarya samanvitaḥ
translated: Unconquerable by all, endowed with the prosperity of yoga,

analyzed: anna daḥ ca api lokebhyaḥ kṣetrapālaḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: And the giver of food to the people, you will be the protector of the fields.

analyzed: mahā balaḥ mahā sattvaḥ mama priyaḥ
translated: You will be greatly powerful, of great spirit, dear to Brahma and to me,

analyzed: tryakṣaḥ ca daṇḍapāṇiḥ ca mahāyogī tathā eva ca
translated: Three-eyed, with a staff in hand, and likewise a great yogi,

analyzed: udbhramaḥ sambhramaḥ ca eva gaṇau te paricārakau
translated: Udbhrama and Sambhrama will be your attendant Ganas.

analyzed: tava ājñayā kariṣyete lokasya udbhrama sambhramau
translated: By your command they will cause confusion and agitation in the world.

analyzed: sanatkumāraḥ uvāca
translated: Sanatkumara said:

original: evaṃ sa bhagavānvyāsa yakṣaṃ kṛtvā gaṇeśvaram /
analyzed: evam sa bhagavān vyāsa yakṣam kṛtvā gaṇeśvaram
translated: O Vyasa, thus the Lord, having made the Yaksha the lord of the Ganas,

original: jagāma dhāma deveśaḥ saha tena sureśvaraḥ // / //
analyzed: jagāma dhāma deveśaḥ saha tena sureśvaraḥ
translated: The Lord of gods, the lord of the gods, went to his abode with him.
